speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: SCENE II. A street.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Enter CAPULET, PARIS, and Servant

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: But Montague is bound as well as I,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: In penalty alike; and 'tis not hard, I think,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: For men so old as we to keep the peace.

speaker: PARIS
text_entry: Of honourable reckoning are you both;

speaker: PARIS
text_entry: And pity 'tis you lived at odds so long.

speaker: PARIS
text_entry: But now, my lord, what say you to my suit?

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: But saying o'er what I have said before:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: My child is yet a stranger in the world;

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: She hath not seen the change of fourteen years,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Let two more summers wither in their pride,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Ere we may think her ripe to be a bride.

speaker: PARIS
text_entry: Younger than she are happy mothers made.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: And too soon marr'd are those so early made.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: The earth hath swallow'd all my hopes but she,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: She is the hopeful lady of my earth:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: But woo her, gentle Paris, get her heart,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: My will to her consent is but a part;

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: An she agree, within her scope of choice

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Lies my consent and fair according voice.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: This night I hold an old accustom'd feast,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Whereto I have invited many a guest,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Such as I love; and you, among the store,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: One more, most welcome, makes my number more.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: At my poor house look to behold this night

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Earth-treading stars that make dark heaven light:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Such comfort as do lusty young men feel

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: When well-apparell'd April on the heel

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Of limping winter treads, even such delight

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Among fresh female buds shall you this night

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Inherit at my house; hear all, all see,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: And like her most whose merit most shall be:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Which on more view, of many mine being one

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: May stand in number, though in reckoning none,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Come, go with me.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: To Servant, giving a paper

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Go, sirrah, trudge about

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Through fair Verona; find those persons out

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Whose names are written there, and to them say,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: My house and welcome on their pleasure stay.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Exeunt CAPULET and PARIS

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Find them out whose names are written here! It is

speaker: Servant
text_entry: written, that the shoemaker should meddle with his

speaker: Servant
text_entry: yard, and the tailor with his last, the fisher with

speaker: Servant
text_entry: his pencil, and the painter with his nets; but I am

speaker: Servant
text_entry: sent to find those persons whose names are here

speaker: Servant
text_entry: writ, and can never find what names the writing

speaker: Servant
text_entry: person hath here writ. I must to the learned.--In good time.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Enter BENVOLIO and ROMEO

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Tut, man, one fire burns out another's burning,

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: One pain is lessen'd by another's anguish;

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Turn giddy, and be holp by backward turning;

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: One desperate grief cures with another's languish:

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Take thou some new infection to thy eye,

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: And the rank poison of the old will die.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Your plaintain-leaf is excellent for that.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: For what, I pray thee?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: For your broken shin.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Why, Romeo, art thou mad?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Not mad, but bound more than a mad-man is;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Shut up in prison, kept without my food,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Whipp'd and tormented and--God-den, good fellow.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: God gi' god-den. I pray, sir, can you read?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Ay, mine own fortune in my misery.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Perhaps you have learned it without book: but, I

speaker: Servant
text_entry: pray, can you read any thing you see?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Ay, if I know the letters and the language.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Ye say honestly: rest you merry!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Stay, fellow; I can read.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Reads

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: 'Signior Martino and his wife and daughters;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: County Anselme and his beauteous sisters; the lady

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: widow of Vitravio; Signior Placentio and his lovely

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: nieces; Mercutio and his brother Valentine; mine

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: uncle Capulet, his wife and daughters; my fair niece

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Rosaline; Livia; Signior Valentio and his cousin

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Tybalt, Lucio and the lively Helena.' A fair

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: assembly: whither should they come?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Up.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Whither?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: To supper; to our house.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Whose house?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: My master's.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Indeed, I should have ask'd you that before.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Now I'll tell you without asking: my master is the

speaker: Servant
text_entry: great rich Capulet; and if you be not of the house

speaker: Servant
text_entry: of Montagues, I pray, come and crush a cup of wine.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Rest you merry!

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: At this same ancient feast of Capulet's

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Sups the fair Rosaline whom thou so lovest,

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: With all the admired beauties of Verona:

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Go thither; and, with unattainted eye,

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Compare her face with some that I shall show,

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: And I will make thee think thy swan a crow.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: When the devout religion of mine eye

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Maintains such falsehood, then turn tears to fires;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And these, who often drown'd could never die,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Transparent heretics, be burnt for liars!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: One fairer than my love! the all-seeing sun

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Ne'er saw her match since first the world begun.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Tut, you saw her fair, none else being by,

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Herself poised with herself in either eye:

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: But in that crystal scales let there be weigh'd

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Your lady's love against some other maid

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: That I will show you shining at this feast,

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: And she shall scant show well that now shows best.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I'll go along, no such sight to be shown,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: But to rejoice in splendor of mine own.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Exeunt
